alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 7:42PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 738 PM EDT, The Hohokus Brook has reached minor flooding and is currently at 3.08 ft as of 7:30pm. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. Additional rainfall later this evening will likely keep the Hohokus Brook in minor flooding for several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ho-Ho-Kus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
